analysis:
Entries in art and design subjects have decreased a little across the UK over the last four years. The -2.8% change compared to a change of -0.7% in all A-Level entries over the last four years.

Across the UK, a broadly similar proportion of students achieved the top grades in art and design subjects in 2017 as did so across all A-Level subjects. A total of 27.5% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in art and design subjects compared to 26.3% for all subjects.

Entries in biology have decreased a little across the UK over the last four years. The -3.4% change compared to a change of -0.7% in all A-Level entries over the last four years.

Across the UK, a broadly similar proportion of students achieved the top grades in biology in 2017 as did so across all A-Level subjects. A total of 26.2% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in biology compared to 26.3% for all subjects.

Entries in business studies have increased across the UK over the last four years. The 12.3% change compared to a change of -0.7% in all A-Level entries over the last four years.

Across the UK, a smaller proportion of students achieved the top grades in business studies in 2017 compared to all A-Level subjects. A total of 15.2% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in business studies compared to 26.3% for all subjects.
